intro: Rinorea hirtella, commonly known as the hairy rinorea, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its small, pale violet or white flowers and hairy stems and leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Rinorea hirtella is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
